channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15722] Size. WAL Files (bytes) in regionserver status page displays negative values
item.description:
Here is the line from ServerMetricTmpl.jamon


TraditionalBinaryPrefix.long2String(mWrap.getWALFileSize(), "B", 1)

I will change this to StringUtils.humanSize()
item.summary: Size. WAL Files (bytes) in regionserver status page displays negative values

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: Here is screen shot. After i have changed it to StringUtils.humanSize() i always see 0 value. This issue probably have root cause somewhere else.
I think the issue is not in the long to human readable conversion. What do you see when you go to /jmx and check the hlogFileSize metric? Is this multi-wal?

Same thing with hlogFileSize in jmx metrics it is negative number. This is defaultWALProvider, i did not change default config. So far i have tracked this to AbstractFSWAL.java:


561         this.totalLogSize.addAndGet(-this.fs.getFileStatus(p).getLen());

This is how we get negative value. What i'm checking now is why 

totalLogSize

end up being negative
Enis Soztutar there was couple of issues calculating total value of WALs files size. Here is patch fixing this issues.

-1 overall

I think this was intended to be: provider.getLogFileSize() + metaProvider.getLogFileSize() from HBASE-14306


-        walFileSize = (provider == null ? 0 : provider.getLogFileSize()) +

-            (provider == null ? 0 : provider.getLogFileSize());

doReplaceWriter() returns the length of the WAL file. Not sure it is the correct calculation though.
Ted Yu, Enis Soztutar thanks for review. Here is new patch adding meta WALs files in calculation as suggested by Enis Soztutar.

Can you also address this comment from above:

doReplaceWriter() returns the length of the WAL file. Not sure it is the correct calculation though.
Sure thing. I assume you mean doReplaceWriter() implementation from FSHLog.java ?

Enis Soztutar here is new patch fixing issue in doReplaceWriter() and using this function for getting WALs file size. Issue was cause because we were getting writer length before writer was closed resulting that return value was less then actual file size on HDFS.
